programme.title: U.S. Open Golf Official Film 1999
programme.desc: A chance to relive the 1999 US Open at the Pinehurst in North Carolina, which featured an unforgettable conclusion on the final day.

programme.title: U.S. Open Golf Official Film 2000
programme.desc: Remember the 2000 US Open, held at Pebble Beach Golf Links. A golfing superstar would take home the title, breaking a Major record in the process.

programme.title: U.S. Open Golf Official Film 2001
programme.desc: Producing one of the wildest endings in championship history, the 2001 US Open at Southern Hills Country Club in Tulsa, Oklahoma, was one to remember.

programme.title: U.S. Open Golf Official Film 2002
programme.desc: The official film of the 2002 US Open chronicles a memorable week on Long Island, as the 2000 champion Tiger Woods displayed his prowess once more in golf's ultimate test.

programme.title: U.S. Open Golf Official Film 2003
programme.desc: The official film of the 2003 US Open, a year in which Jim Furyk put on one of the best scoring displays in the championship's history.

programme.title: U.S. Open Golf Official Film 2004
programme.desc: A chance to relive the 2004 US Open at Shinnecock Hills Golf Club in New York. A former champion would win this tournament for the second time.

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf Highlights
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from the 2025 RBC Canadian Open, a PGA Tour event taking place at TPC Toronto.

programme.title: DP World Tour Golf Highlights
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from the 2025 KLM Open, a DP World Tour event held at the International in Amsterdam.

programme.title: In Bloom: The Justin Rose Story
programme.desc: A look at Justin Rose's momentous victory in the 2013 US Open. The Englishman discusses both the highs and lows that prepared him for success at Merion Golf Club.

programme.title: McGinley & Chamblee At The US Open
programme.desc: Join Paul McGinley and Brandel Chamblee as they preview the action ahead of the 125th edition of the US Open Championship at Oakmont Country Club.

programme.desc: The 125th US Open Championship is almost here - join the game's leading stars and pundits for all the build-up ahead of the third men's Major of 2025.

programme.title: Ladies European Tour Golf Hlts
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from the Tenerife Women's Open, a Ladies European Tour event held at Abama Golf.

programme.title: DP World Tour Golf Highlights
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from the 2025 KLM Open, a DP World Tour event held at the International in Amsterdam.

programme.title: U.S. Open Golf Official Film 2006
programme.desc: Revisit the 2006 US Open, a tournament remembered for Geoff Ogilvy's late surge to the crown, outlasting home favourite Phil Mickelson.

programme.title: U.S. Open Golf Official Film 2007
programme.desc: The story of the 2007 US Open Championship at Oakmont Country Club in Pennsylvania. Geoff Ogilvy was aiming to become the first player to retain his title since Curtis Strange in 1989.

programme.title: U.S. Open Golf Official Film 2008
programme.desc: Ahead of the US Open, the year's second golf major, take a look back to 2008 with the official film of the tournament. Argentina's Angel Cabrera was the defending champion from 2007.

programme.title: U.S. Open Golf Official Film 2009
programme.desc: A review of the 2009 US Open which was held at Bethpage State Park, New York. It was the second Major of the year and another memorable event, with American Lucas Glover the victor.

programme.title: U.S. Open Golf Official Film 2010
programme.desc: A look back at the 2010 US Open at Pebble Beach Golf Links. It was a tournament that saw Ryder Cup star Graeme McDowell take his game to a whole new level.

programme.title: U.S. Open Golf Official Film 2011
programme.desc: A chance to relive the 2011 US Open which was held at Congressional Country Club in Maryland. Northern Ireland's Rory McIlroy stormed to the first Major title of his career.

programme.title: U.S. Open Golf Official Film 2012
programme.desc: The story of the 2012 US Open Championship from the Olympic Club in San Francisco. Northern Irishman Rory McIlroy won this tournament by an incredible eight strokes in 2011.

programme.title: Ladies European Tour Golf Hlts
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from the Tenerife Women's Open, a Ladies European Tour event held at Abama Golf.

programme.title: McGinley & Chamblee At The US Open
programme.desc: Join Paul McGinley and Brandel Chamblee as they preview the action ahead of the 125th edition of the US Open Championship at Oakmont Country Club.

programme.desc: Ahead of the US Open, the year's second golf major, take a look back to 2008 with the official film of the tournament. Argentina's Angel Cabrera was the defending champion from 2007.

programme.desc: Join Paul McGinley and Brandel Chamblee as they preview the action ahead of the 125th edition of the US Open Championship at Oakmont Country Club.

programme.title: Live From The U.S. Open
programme.desc: The 125th US Open Championship is almost here - join the game's leading stars and pundits for all the build-up ahead of the third men's Major of 2025.

programme.title: Fitzpatrick: The Boss of Brookline
programme.desc: Reflect on Matt Fitzpatrick's famous U.S. Open win at Brookline Country Club and his career trajectory. Featuring exclusive interviews with his family, Caddie Billy Foster and more.

programme.title: PGA Tour: The Cut
programme.desc: A look behind the scenes of the PGA Tour. Follow the world's best players as they prepare for the big events in 2025.

programme.title: HotelPlanner Tour Golf
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from the HotelPlanner Tour's visit to Lucerne for the Swiss Challenge at Golf Sempach.

programme.title: U.S. Open Golf Official Film 2013
programme.desc: A chance to relive the 2013 US Open at Merion Golf Club in Ardmore, Pennsylvania. America's Webb Simpson claimed a narrow one-stroke victory the previous year.

programme.title: U.S. Open Golf Official Film 2014
programme.desc: The story of the 2014 US Open Championship at the No. 2 Course of the Pinehurst Resort in North Carolina. England's Justin Rose came into this event as the defending champion.

programme.title: U.S. Open Golf Official Film 2015
programme.desc: The official film of the 2015 US Open, one of golf's four majors. Martin Kaymer went in as the defending champion from 2014.

programme.title: U.S. Open Golf Official Film 2016
programme.desc: The official film of the 2016 US Open. Hosted at Oakmont Country Club in Pennsylvania, one of the world's most difficult courses, Jordan Spieth came in as the defending champion.

programme.title: U.S. Open Golf Official Film 2017
programme.desc: The official film of the 2017 US Open. Hosted at Erin Hills in Wisconsin, Dustin Johnson came into the tournament as the defending champion from the previous year.

programme.title: PGA Tour: The Cut
programme.desc: A look behind the scenes of the PGA Tour. Follow the world's best players as they prepare for the big events in 2025.

programme.title: HotelPlanner Tour Golf
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from the HotelPlanner Tour's visit to Lucerne for the Swiss Challenge at Golf Sempach.

programme.title: U.S. Open Golf Official Film 2018
programme.desc: The official film of the 2018 US Open, held at Shinnecock Hills Golf Course. On an exceptionally challenging course, Brooks Koepka was aiming to retain his title from 2017.

programme.title: U.S. Open Golf Official Film 2019
programme.desc: The official film of the 2019 US Open from the iconic Pebble Beach Golf Links. It was to be a memorable tournament on the California coast for a first-time Major winner.

programme.title: U.S. Open Golf Official Film 2020
programme.desc: The official film of the 2020 US Open from Winged Foot Golf Club, the scene of Bryson DeChambeau's triumph, as he outlasted the debutant Matthew Wolff.

programme.title: PGA Tour Originals: Tiger 2000
programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look at one of the most iconic seasons in golf as Tiger Woods changed the landscape of the sport securing nine victories, including three Major championships.

programme.title: McGinley & Chamblee At The US Open
programme.desc: Join Paul McGinley and Brandel Chamblee as they preview the action ahead of round one of the 2025 US Open Championship at Oakmont Country Club.

programme.title: Live U.S. Open Golf Round 1
programme.desc: The opening round of the 125th US Open from Oakmont Country Club. Last year, Bryson DeChambeau snatched the second of his two US Open wins, capitalising on Rory McIlroy's late collapse.

programme.title: WTA Final: Miami
programme.desc: In Miami, the women's final get underway as top seed Aryna Sabalenka meets with home favourite Jessica Pegula in a repeat of last year's US Open decider. (29.03)

programme.title: Bitesize Tennis Classics
programme.desc: Take a look back at the best of Sky Sports' coverage of the ATP Tour in 2024.

programme.title: Bitesize Tennis Classics
programme.desc: Take a look back at the best of Sky Sports' coverage of the WTA Tour in 2024.

programme.title: Bitesize Tennis Classics
programme.desc: A look back at the best moments from Jack Draper's 2024 season, including tournament wins in Stuttgart and Vienna.

programme.title: Bitesize Tennis Classics
programme.desc: British number one Katie Boulter looks to win her first WTA 500 title as she takes on Marta Kostyuk in the final of the San Diego Open. Kostyuk knocked out the top seed to get here. (03.03)

programme.title: McEnroe v Borg 1980
programme.desc: With the French Open and Wimbledon secured, Bjorn Borg met defending champion John McEnroe in the men's singles final at the 1980 US Open. Borg was bidding for his first US Open title.

programme.title: ATP Final: Rome
programme.desc: World number one Jannik Sinner takes on soon-to-be world number two Carlos Alcaraz in a blockbuster Italian Open final. Between them, the pair have won the last five majors. (18.05)

programme.title: WTA Final: Rome
programme.desc: A women's singles champion is crowned at the Italian Open, as home favourite and world number five Jasmine Paolini faces the American Coco Gauff. (17.05)

programme.title: Tennis Highlights
programme.desc: Britain's Jacob Fearnley competes in grass-court action against American sixth seed Brandon Nakashima in Stuttgart. Fearnley comes from a third-round run at the French Open. (09.06)

programme.title: Tennis Highlights
programme.desc: Elise Mertens plays in an opening-round contest at the Libema Open in 's-Hertogenbosch, as the third seed gets her grass court season underway against Bulgaria's Viktoriya Tomova. (09.06)

programme.title: Live Tennis: Day 2
programme.desc: Fabio Fognini competes in grass-court action as the 2013 Stuttgart champion faces Corentin Moutet before Gael Monfils meets seventh seed Alex Michelsen. Bianca Andreescu also features.

programme.title: ATP Final: Madrid
programme.desc: Britain's Jack Draper steps on court for the Madrid Open final aiming to lift his second Masters 1000 crown, as the 23-year-old faces 14th seed Casper Ruud for the first time. (04.05)

programme.title: WTA Final: Madrid
programme.desc: In a repeat of the 2023 US Open final, two-time Madrid champion Aryna Sabalenka eyes another marquee title against Coco Gauff, who won their only prior clay-court meeting. (03.05)

programme.title: Tennis Highlights
programme.desc: An opening-round men's singles encounter from the Libema Open in 's-Hertogenbosch between the fifth seed Hubert Hurkacz of Poland and Spain's Roberto Bautista Agut. (10.06)

programme.title: Tennis Highlights
programme.desc: The seasoned Italian Fabio Fognini targets round two of ATP Stuttgart, a tournament he won back in 2013, as the 38-year-old takes on Frenchman Corentin Moutet. (10.06)

programme.title: Tie Break Tens Highlights
programme.desc: A stacked field of mixed-doubles pairings, including Keys, Swiatek, Fritz, Boulter, De Minaur, Tsitsipas, Rybakina and many more, compete for the Eisenhower Cup under Tie Break 10s rules.

programme.title: Bitesize Tennis Classics
programme.desc: Bitesize highlights of men's British number one Jack Draper's first ATP 500 final, as the US Open semi-finalist fought Karen Khachanov for the Erste Bank Open trophy in Vienna. (27.10)

programme.title: Bitesize Tennis Classics
programme.desc: Jack Draper goes for his first ATP Tour title as the Brit competes in the Stuttgart final against a former Wimbledon finalist and two-time champion here, Matteo Berrettini. (16.06)

programme.title: Bitesize Tennis Classics
programme.desc: In a rematch of the 2023 Madrid Open final, world number one Iga Swiatek and defending champion Aryna Sabalenka meet again to determine this year's women's singles champion. (04.05)

programme.title: Bitesize Tennis Classics
programme.desc: Frances Tiafoe joins Laura Robson on the Sky Sports Tennis podcast to answer 10 questions about his life and career, including a debate on love v success and his dream dinner party guests.

programme.title: McEnroe v Borg 1981
programme.desc: In winning the 1981 US Open men's singles title, John McEnroe inflicted a career-ending defeat upon long-time rival Bjorn Borg, as the Swede later retired from the professional game.

programme.desc: Britain's Jack Draper steps on court for the Madrid Open final aiming to lift his second Masters 1000 crown, as the 23-year-old faces 14th seed Casper Ruud for the first time. (04.05)

programme.desc: In a repeat of the 2023 US Open final, two-time Madrid champion Aryna Sabalenka eyes another marquee title against Coco Gauff, who won their only prior clay-court meeting. (03.05)
